title: art
descriptive_sentence: Art is something that stimulates an individual's thoughts, emotions, beliefs, or ideas through the senses.

children.title: artwork
children.descriptive_sentence: Artwork refers to visual or auditory creations that are intended to be appreciated for their beauty or emotional power.

children.title: 3d artwork
children.descriptive_sentence: Artwork refers to visual or auditory creations that are intended to be appreciated for their beauty or emotional power.

title: audio
descriptive_sentence: Audio refers to sounds, music, spoken words, or other auditory elements.

children.title: audio recording
children.descriptive_sentence: An audio recording captures sounds, music, or spoken words in a digital or analog format.

children.title: podcast
children.descriptive_sentence: A podcast is a series of audio episodes that can cover various topics and be accessed through the internet.

children.title: interview
children.descriptive_sentence: An interview is a conversation or discussion between two or more people, typically recorded, where one person asks questions and others provide answers or opinions.

title: documents
descriptive_sentence: Documents refer to written or printed materials that contain information or provide evidence.

children.title: books
children.descriptive_sentence: Books are written or printed works consisting of pages bound together, often containing stories, information, or ideas.

children.title: book
children.descriptive_sentence: A book is a written or printed work that is usually published and has a title, author, and content.

children.title: book selection
children.descriptive_sentence: A book selection refers to a curated or chosen set of books, often with a specific theme or purpose.

children.title: legal
children.descriptive_sentence: Legal documents pertain to laws, regulations, cases, patents, and statutes.

children.title: case
children.descriptive_sentence: A case refers to a legal dispute or controversy that is brought before a court for resolution.

children.title: patent
children.descriptive_sentence: A patent is a legal document that grants exclusive rights to an invention, usually for a specified period.

children.title: statute
children.descriptive_sentence: A statute is a written law passed by a legislative body and enacted as a formal rule.

children.title: scholarly
children.descriptive_sentence: Scholarly documents include academic and research-oriented materials such as conference papers, preprints, reports, and theses.

children.title: conference paper
children.descriptive_sentence: A conference paper is a scholarly work presented at an academic conference or symposium.

children.title: preprint
children.descriptive_sentence: A preprint is a research paper that is publicly available before formal peer review and publication.

children.title: report
children.descriptive_sentence: A report is a document that presents detailed information or findings about a specific topic or issue.

children.title: thesis
children.descriptive_sentence: A thesis is a document submitted by a candidate for an academic degree, presenting their research findings.

children.title: written works
children.descriptive_sentence: Written works encompass various forms of written content such as bills, blog posts, dictionary entries, documents, emails, encyclopedia articles, forum posts, journal articles, letters, magazine articles, and manuscripts.

children.title: bill
children.descriptive_sentence: A bill is a proposed law or legislation that is presented for consideration by a legislative body.

children.title: blog post
children.descriptive_sentence: A blog post is an article or entry posted on a blog, typically offering opinions, information, or experiences.

children.title: dictionary entry
children.descriptive_sentence: A dictionary entry is a word or term along with its definition and other relevant information listed in a dictionary.

children.title: document
children.descriptive_sentence: A document is a written, printed, or electronic record that provides information or serves as evidence.

children.title: email
children.descriptive_sentence: An email is an electronic message sent over a computer network, typically used for communication purposes.

children.title: encyclopedia article
children.descriptive_sentence: An encyclopedia article is a detailed and informative entry on a specific topic, usually found in an encyclopedia.

children.title: forum post
children.descriptive_sentence: A forum post is a message or discussion posted on an online forum or discussion board.

children.title: journal article
children.descriptive_sentence: A journal article is a scholarly paper or research study published in an academic journal.

children.title: letter
children.descriptive_sentence: A letter is a written or printed communication addressed to someone, often conveying personal or formal messages.

children.title: magazine article
children.descriptive_sentence: A magazine article is a written piece published in a magazine, typically covering various topics of interest.

children.title: manuscript
children.descriptive_sentence: A manuscript is an author's handwritten or typewritten work that is submitted for publication.

children.title: data and research
children.descriptive_sentence: Data and research documents include datasets and maps used for analysis, visualization, or study purposes.

children.title: dataset
children.descriptive_sentence: A dataset is a collection of structured data organized for analysis, typically in electronic format.

children.title: map
children.descriptive_sentence: A map is a visual representation of an area, region, or geographical information.

title: TV and broadcasts
descriptive_sentence: TV and broadcasts refer to television programs and video recordings aired on television or radio.

children.title: TV broadcast
children.descriptive_sentence: A TV broadcast is a television program or transmission that is aired to a wide audience.

children.title: video recording
children.descriptive_sentence: A video recording captures visual and auditory content in a digital or analog format.

children.title: radio broadcast
children.descriptive_sentence: A radio broadcast is an audio program or transmission that is aired on radio frequencies.
